thread.title: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson found dead by cleaner
thread.title_full: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson found dead by cleaner

author: Hannah Furness
title: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson found dead by cleaner
text:
Tara Palmer-Tomkinson found dead by cleaner Tara Palmer-Tomkinson, who has died aged 45 Harry Yorke 9 February 2017 â€¢ 10:42am 
T ara Palmer-Tomkinson was found dead by her cleaner, who burst into tears before setting off an alarm for help. 
The Portuguese cleaner, in her 30s, arrived at the It girl's West London flat at around 1.30pm on Wednesday and was heard crying by builders renovating the apartment below. 
The 45-year-old former model had been heard hoovering and walking around her flat the previous Wednesday and had previously complained several times about the builders to the flat's owner. Palmer-Tomkinson with family friend the Prince of Wales 
F ive builders renovating the property since September say they saw the cleaner visit the flat twice a week. 
The former 'It' girl , who lived in a plush fifth floor apartment in Earls Court, had also failed to collect three item of post from downstairs. 
A doormat with a cartoon image of her carrying designer bags is at the entrance to her flat. Tara Palmer-Tomkinson modelling in 1998 
O ne of the builders, who last saw her on Saturday January 14th, said: "We could hear her walking around upstairs last week. 
"She was cleaning. We could hear hoovering on Wednesday. 
"It was the cleaner who found her. She was crying and it was very quiet before she arrived and set off the alarm." 
He added: "We didn't hear Tara often and the last time we saw her was on Saturday January 14th when there was a leak coming from her flat. 
"We didn't ever see anyone going in or out. Tara Palmer Tomkinson Pictured In 1996 
"Maybe the cleaner was panicking and set off the alarm." 
M inutes after the cleaner set off the alarm an ambulance arrived with several paramedics, followed by three police cars. 
Friends had spoken of their fears for Palmer-Tomkinson, who had become increasingly frail and withdrawn after becoming ill last year. 
In recent interviews, she had defended herself against speculation she had fallen off the wagon, revealing her weight loss was down to a non-malignant brain tumour which had affected her hormones. Tara Palmer-Tomkinson with her family 
T he builders said they had not been spoken to by police. 
A spokesman for the Metropolitan Police said: "Police were called by London Ambulance Service at approximately 13:40hrs on Wednesday February 8 to an address in Bramham Gardens, SW5. 
"A woman, aged in her 40s, was pronounced dead at the scene. 
"At this early stage, the death is being treated as unexplained. 
"We are not treating this death as suspicious. The coroner has been informed and the next of kin has been informed."
